instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
Ppbus_g3h is 1v 
Pp3v42 is 2.6v 
All_sys_pwrgd=0v 
I have removed u8150 no changes...
No corrosion on the motherboard 
R7012 is fine and f7000 is okay...
What to do?

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
Remove F7140 and check C7140 voltage.
Also check diode mode to ground on both sides of the fuse.

Post U7100 basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

Did you try fake charger, or lab PSU?

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
After removing F7140 pin1 is =0.435 pin 2 is 0.175
0V at c7140

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message: Should i post u7100 voltages without F7140

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
"3=0v"
Check diode mode to ground.
C7111 and R7110 are the suspects there.

Post now U7090 voltages.
Check diode mode to ground at L7095.

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
C7111=0.003
R7110=0.003

diode mode to ground at L7095=2.005
U7090 voltages 
Pin1=1.3v
Pin2=1.942v
Pin3=4.3v
Pin4=1.9v
Pin5=gnd
Pin6=16v
Pin7=unconnected
Pin8=16v
Pin9=gnd

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
Remove C7111 and check diode mode again.
If still short, replace U7100.

"diode mode to ground at L7095=2.005"
Please check correctly...

Check R7095/96 values and traces.
If good, replace U7090.

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
R7095 is broken can i replace with a 200kohm resistor? 
have replaced u7000 short gone

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
I have replaced R7095 
Ppbus_g3h still 3v
Pp3v42_g3h=3.42

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message: Bad u7100...it was from a donor board now replaced with new one thanks 😊

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message: 😢 the board stopped working now ppbus_g3h is now 5V after coupling

threads.title: 820-00164 dead no green light
threads.message:
Maybe bad solders.
Be sure C7125 is good.

Post again U7100 voltages.
